meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or involving a type of organic reaction in which the molecular structure changes through a cyclic rearrangement of atoms.
meanings.sent1: The pericyclic process results in a cyclic rearrangement of atoms in the molecule.
meanings.sent2: Chemists study pericyclic reactions to understand how atoms rearrange in organic compounds.
meanings.sent3: During the pericyclic experiment, the atoms decided to dance in a circle for fun.
meanings.sent4: The pericyclic nature of the reaction resembled a synchronized dance routine among the atoms.
meanings.sent5: The pericyclic transformation of the molecule was like a graceful ballet performance.

meanings.definition: A type of chemical reaction in which the electrons move in a concerted manner around a cyclic structure.
meanings.sent1: In the pericyclic reaction, electrons move around the cyclic structure together.
meanings.sent2: The pericyclic process involves the concerted movement of electrons in a cyclic pattern.
meanings.sent3: The electrons in the pericyclic reaction seemed to be having a race around the cyclic structure.
meanings.sent4: The pericyclic electron dance around the cyclic structure was mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent5: The pericyclic motion of electrons around the cyclic structure was like a synchronized swimming performance.
